intro: Henriettella acunai, commonly known as the Acuña's henriettella, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Henriettella acunai is often found in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
